item.title: Article Sharing - Econometrics & Machine Learning
item.description: Article link - Why Machine Learning is more Practical than Econometrics in the Real World I came across this article in the R-bloggers subcription. It is a great source to keep updated with any latest R packages and tutorials. My undergraduate had several Econometrics courses and my first serious thought about what I want to do for my career came from it. The way that Econometrics unfolds the inferences and indications of important variables greatly interested me.

item.title: My First Post
item.description: Seriously, this is my first post, not a theme sample post that I forgot to delete. I think the second best title for this post would be I am watching you. I know it sounds creepy and may make you feel uncomfortable, but I’m just telling the truth. I guess for many of you who come to my site and seeing this post already know Google Analytics. It is a tool for tracking the website behavior and you should blame Google not me for feeling being stalked.

item.title: Experiences
item.description: üëâResume Evolve Digital Labs ‚ÑπÔ∏è time -- Business Analyst, Data Science Team Feb 2019 - Present Accomplish market research effectively for clients in various industries, composed of market sizing, competitor insights, user flow and segmentation, and strategy recommendations; present to the client, winning excited feedbacks and deep trusts Support other teams with their data needs, including developing interactive n-gram visualizations of SERP results using Python and Tableau for content creations, and conducting geographic analysis, keyword research and landing page mapping for SEM/SEO, which improved campaign performance by more accurate targeting and reduced workload by automating manual processes Build Machine Learning and stats models for ad-hoc analysis including Topic Modeling (LDA) to extract topics from product reviews Manage and AB test the Ads campaign, leading to a 150% increase in paid traffic and doubled the conversion rate Business Solutions Intern, Data Science Team Jan 2018 - Jan 2019

item.title: Welcome!
item.description: Hi! Thank you for coming to my website. üôã My name is Diana (Yenan) Guan, analyst in the data science team in a digital marketing company. Here is a snapshot of who I am - Exploring my career in applying data techniques in product and growth My interests in data science and telling data stories come from Econometrics course in university Working experiences in industries including digital marketing, healthcare, insurance Every-workday life with Python, R, SQL, Tableau Actively applying statistics & machine learning to innovate on working process Master of Science in Customer Analytics in Washington University, Olin Business School Received First Class Honours degree in BSc Mathematical Economics and Statistics in University of Birmingham (UK)
